remarks: Membership in an upper set of integers.  We use the fact that a function's value (under our function value definition) is empty outside of its domain to show ` M e. ZZ ` .  (Contributed by NM, 5-Sep-2005.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-Nov-2013.)
statement: eluz2 $p |- ( N e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) <-> ( M e. ZZ /\ N e. ZZ /\ M <_ N ) ) $.
